snippet: One in five American consumers have blemishes on their credit reports because of overdue medical bills.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column cites Consumer Financial Protection Bureau report that finds one in five American consumers have marks against them on their credit reports due to unpaid medical bills; notes report follows bureau's previous findings that medical debt, which makes up more than half of collection items on credit reports, can unfairly harm credit scores.
lead_paragraph: One in five American consumers have blemishes on their credit reports because of overdue medical bills.

headline.main: Federal Report Highlights the Effects of Medical Debts on Credit
headline.print_headline: Federal Report Highlights the Effects of Medical Debts on Credit
